title: CASSANDRA-16406 Move merkle tree mismatch debug loggings to trace level
body:
Debug logging being enabled by default in Cassandra, too many logger.debug() calls in the Merkle trees comparisons ended up having a significant impact on repair performance.
Such loggings are useful for Cassandra developers mostly and they were moved to trace level to avoid impacting production clusters.

Update datacenter definition
body: As part of the CS 425 - Distributed Systems class at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign we are learning about being more mindful of the language used in distributed systems technology especially from the perspective of systemic racism. The pull request here suggests replacing "segregation" which has associations with historical racial segregation with "isolation"

title: Correct header for STCS documentation.
body:
In the STCS documentation switch the header "Levelled Compaction Strategy" to the corrected "Size Tiered Compaction Strategy" to make this documentation easier to find via search. 

Fixes the documentation issue referenced at [this Jira](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CASSANDRA-16282). (Apologies, the Jira ticket was probably overkill for such a small change. I'm a first time contributor on this project.)

CASSANDRA-16186 (3.11): Remove the SEPExecutor blocking behavior
body:
If the number of tasks added to a SEPExecutor exceed the max queue size, the threads adding those task will be block until enough space become available for all the blocked tasks. At this point all the blocked threads will be released at once.

As the maxTasksQueued was always set to INTEGER.MAX_VALUE, the code was in practice never using. By consequence, removing the code was a better option than trying to fix it.

title: CASSANDRA-16186 (3.0): Remove the SEPExecutor blocking behavior
body:
If the number of tasks added to a SEPExecutor exceed the max queue size, the threads adding those task will be block until enough space become available for all the blocked tasks. At this point all the blocked threads will be released at once.

As the maxTasksQueued was always set to INTEGER.MAX_VALUE, the code was in practice never using. By consequence, removing the code was a better option than trying to fix it.
